name: growthy
content:
growthy adjective
(ANIMALS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of farm animals) quickly growing to a large size: The farmers feed the cows a healthy diet in the hope that they produce growthy calves. He prefers to raise growthy sheep for their meat, while those closer to a normal size are still raised for their wool.

Becoming bigger
growthy adjective
(FINANCE)
(of an investment) likely to earn a lot of money or value in a short time: The broker added a number of high-yield growthy technology stocks to his client's portfolio. While it is tempting to go after growthy investments, in this economy you may wish to be more conservative to moderate risk.
